pageContext.claim: “I've ended the Obama administration's war on coal and we're putting our wonderful coal miners back to work producing beautiful clean coal.”
pageContext.analysis: According to the Bureau of Labor Statistics, only 1,600 jobs have been created in the coal industry since Trump became president — an increase of 3 percent. Administration officials often misleadingly refer to “mining” jobs, which mostly consist of jobs in the oil sector, which has rebounded from a price slump that has little to do with administration policies.
